heif

Class BoxHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • heif.BoxHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageHandler, java.lang.Iterable<Box>

    public class BoxHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImageHandler, java.lang.Iterable<Box>
    Handles parsing of HEIF/HEIC file structures based on the ISO Base Media Format. Supports Exif extraction, box navigation, and hierarchical parsing.

    For detailed specifications, see:

    • ISO/IEC 14496-12:2015
    • ISO/IEC 23008-12:2017

    API Note: According to HEIF/HEIC standards, some box types are optional and may appear zero or one time per file.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • getExifData

        public java.util.Optional<byte[]> getExifData()
                                       throws ImageReadErrorException
        Extracts the embedded Exif TIFF block from the HEIF container.

        Supports multi-extent Exif data and correctly applies the TIFF header offset as specified in the Exif payload. If no Exif block is found, Optional.empty() is returned.

        The returned byte array starts at the TIFF header, excluding the standard Exif identifier prefix (usually Exif\0\0). According to ISO/IEC 23008-12:2017 Annex A (p. 37), the first 4 bytes of the Exif item payload contain exifTiffHeaderOffset, which specifies the offset from the start of the payload to the TIFF header.

        The TIFF header typically begins with two magic bytes indicating byte order:

        • 0x4D 0x4D – Motorola (big-endian)
        • 0x49 0x49 – Intel (little-endian)
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the TIFF-compatible Exif block as a byte array if present, otherwise, Optional.empty()
        Throws:
        ImageReadErrorException - if the Exif block is missing, malformed, or cannot be located

      • getSafeFileSize

        public long getSafeFileSize()
        Returns the length of the image file associated with the current InputStream resource.
        Specified by:
        getSafeFileSize in interface ImageHandler
        Returns:
        the length of the file in bytes, or 0 if the size cannot be determined

      • parseMetadata

        public boolean parseMetadata()
        Parses the image data stream and attempts to extract metadata from the HEIF container.

        After calling this method, you can retrieve the extracted Exif block (if present) by invoking getExifData().

        Specified by:
        parseMetadata in interface ImageHandler
        Returns:
        true if at least one HEIF box was successfully parsed and extracted, or false if no relevant boxes were found

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<Box> iterator()
        Returns a depth-first iterator over all parsed boxes, starting from root boxes.

        The iteration respects the hierarchy of boxes, processing children before siblings (depth-first traversal).

        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<Box>
        Returns:
        an Iterator for recursively visiting all boxes

      • displayHierarchy

        public void displayHierarchy()
        Displays all box types in a hierarchical fashion, useful for debugging, visualisation or diagnostics.
